intro: Fimbristylis puberula, commonly known as the hairy fringed sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, three-lobed flowers. Its roots are fibrous and help stabilize the soil in wetland habitats. Fimbristylis puberula plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its native wetlands by providing habitat and food for various organisms.
